channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Christchurch mosque shooter did not want to appear in person
item.description: Court documents which were suppressed until the end of the sentencing show the shooter applied to appear via audio-visual link.

item.title: Covid-19 update: Five new confirmed community cases and seven imported cases
item.description: There are 12 new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, including five confirmed community cases and seven imported cases. Watch the latest update here.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates in New Zealand and around the world on 28 August
item.description: With two days to go until the alert levels are due to drop, Grant Robertson has thanked Aucklanders for their efforts under Alert Level 3. Follow all the latest developments with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: No guarantee mass killer would serve full jail term in Australia
item.description: An Auckland University law professor says there's a risk the Christchurch mosque terrorist could walk the streets of Sydney if he was deported to Australia to serve his life sentence.

item.title: Comancheros head pleads guilty to participating in organised crime
item.description: The president of the Comancheros in New Zealand has admitted participating in an organised crime group.

item.title: Wage subsidy extension: $33 million paid out in first week
item.description: More than 30,000 jobs are being supported by the government's new wage subsidy scheme.

item.title: Police call for stronger counter-terrorism laws
item.description: Police want greater legislative powers for dealing with terrorism, following laws in place in the United Kingdom.

item.title: US ambassador Scott Brown dodges managed isolation in New Zealand after US trip
item.description: United States Ambassador Scott Brown dodged New Zealand's mandated isolation and quarantine facilities when returning from a visit to the US.

item.title: Mosque attack hero: 'We achieved what we wanted'
item.description: A man who confronted a terrorist on the day of the killings and again during his sentencing in the High Court says the perpetrator has got "what he deserved".

item.title: Guled Mire: Sentencing just a part of a long healing journey
item.description: Muslim community advocate Guled Mire says that while the New Zealand public has shown incredible aroha to victims of the mosque attacks, there are concerns about how long it will last.

item.title: ECE pay talks paused, up to $10m needed says union
item.description: Pay talks for hundreds of early childhood teachers have again paused while employers and the teachers' union, the NZEI, urge the government to bankroll higher pay rates.

item.title: Norway's different approach to the trial of a mass murderer
item.description: While Norway opted to bring every possible detail to light during the 10-week trial of Breivik, a Norwegian journalist says the case against the Christchurch shooter seems "dimly lit".

item.title: Police seek witnesses for firearm incident in Alexandra
item.description: Police say they urgently want to hear from anyone who saw a gun being pointed at a person in Alexandra yesterday afternoon.

item.title: Christchurch mosque attacks: Terrorist sentenced to life in jail without parole
item.description: The man who carried out the mosque attacks in Christchurch on 15 March 2019 has been sentenced to a life in prison and will never leave jail.

item.title: Bloomfield should axe CDHB says board member: 'Mend the relationships'
item.description: The Director General of Health was greeted by hundreds of protesters this morning when he arrived at a meeting with the beleaguered Canterbury District Health Board.

item.title: Relieved victims react: 'We represent love, compassion - that is us'
item.description: Muslims realise no punishment given to the mosque terrorist can bring back their loved ones - but the sentence has shown they can stand together against terrorists, an imam says.

item.title: Public transport face mask rules: how they work and the penalties for not obeying
item.description: From Monday everyone over the age of 12 will have to wear a mask or face covering on public transport and planes under alert level 2 or higher - but not on the school bus.

item.title: IPCA report into Alo Ngata's death 'disturbing reading', lawyer says
item.description: An IPCA report has identifed multiple failures by police officers who restrained Alo Ngata, who was on meth when arrested for assaulting an elderly man. He later died in hospital.
